entry.title: Take a chance on me
entry.summary:
Author: Panickymouse29

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,919Chapters: 46/?Kudos: 36

Summary: Aileen Allen was recruited into the Avatar Program at twenty-two after drawing RDA attention for her effectiveness in close-quarters security operations where escalation repeatedly failed. She wasn’t chosen for aggression, but for control—she ended threats quickly and quietly in environments where firearms were a liability. The RDA classified her as difficult: independent, resistant to rigid command, and openly critical of excessive force. Those traits would normally have ended her candidacy. Dr. Grace Augustine intervened, citing Aileen’s adaptability and restraint as exactly what the program lacked. On Pandora, Aileen immediately modified her uniform for mobility and heat, ignoring protocol in favour of survival. She demonstrated an unusual tendency to de-escalate Na’vi encounters rather than provoke them, earning Grace’s quiet approval—and RDA’s suspicion. By the time Jake Sully arrived, Aileen was already operating on the fringe of RDA control: respected by the scientists, tolerated by command, and trusted by Grace to act when others would make things worse.Pandora didn’t recruit Aileen Allen. Grace Augustine did.

entry.title: Save a Horse, Ride a Cowboy
entry.summary:
Author: frogonadollar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,076Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 3

Summary: Clark wants to take Bruce home for the holidays to meet his parents. They visit a bar Clark used to frequent in college where Bruce learns something new about the boyscout. Mechanical bull riding and a flirtatious bartender do not make for a good mix. Bruce didn't think he was the jealous type... until he is. - Bruce smirks, “I don’t know what you and that country boy got up to in here…” He walks his fingers up to grip his chin harshly. “But I can promise I’ll treat you so much better you’ll forget every bit of it.” Eidetic memory be damned. There are stars in Clark’s eyes when he swallows, submission in the soft and dazed nod he responds with. “Good boy,” and Clark preens at the praise. “You’re going to take what I give you and be grateful for it.” Bruce’s voice is heavy with desire. He maintains eye contact as he slides down that impossibly muscular body to situate between Clark’s thighs.

entry.title: home is where the heart is
entry.summary:
Author: phospeony

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,883Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 112

Summary: Clark groans, covering his face with both hands. “I- there was- I got evicted from my apartment.”“I’m sorry,” Bruce says after a pregnant perturbed pause. “I think I misheard you say that Superman, as in the flying, bulletproof, solar-powered alien savior of mankind, got evicted from his apartment.”“They don’t know I’m Superman!” Clark protests immediately, dropping his hands. “That’s the whole— No, that’s not the point.”or:Clark gets evicted from his apartment. Somehow, that's where it all starts.

entry.summary:
Author: Sinlesschick6

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,938Chapters: 4/7Kudos: 47

Summary: Bruce Wayne spent his life trying to run away from his own feelings. He learned to build up walls, ways to protect himself. He split himself in two, Bruce Wayne billionaire playboy, and Batman the dark knight. Then he meets Clark Kent, who rather than breaking through his walls, he finds the door and walks right in. Clark opens him up, and finds the Bruce he thought died and was buried years ago. Ps. Alfred is a saint and Lois is a good friend

entry.title: The Company We Keep
entry.summary:
Author: WrenA

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,951Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 60

Summary: They say you can tell a person by the company they keep and all Barry could say about Superman was that he was far from the goodie-two-shoes everyone made him out to be initially. If you were to go by said company:- The colleagues at the Daily Planet and especially Lois and Jimmy- Clark's parents who always send sweets- Clark's close friend, Thomas, who sports a permanent stubble, disheveled hair and dark circles under the eyes- The mysterious 'B' who Superman sometimes calls to call in a favor when something requires a more tricky investigation- Nightwing, who is part of the league but acts incredibly familiar to Supes- An assortment of friends that he keeps mentioning- A (possible) crime lord whose file keeps getting deleted from the Watchtower databases- An array of vigilantes that absolutely refuse to join the league and have an unhealthy obsession for bats- THE BATMAN!? THE BATMAN IS REAL and does Superman know BATMAN!?- Lex Luthor, a homicidal billionaire- Bruce Wayne, not a homicidal billionaire, just annoying- Superman's kids?!? Or glimpses into the life of Superman over time, as seen through the eyes of one Barry Allen.
